column1: 1 ^ Attèndite
column2: pòpule meus
column3: legem meam~; inclináte aŭrem vèstram in vèrba oris mei. ^ Attend
column4: O my people
column5: to my law~; incline your ears to the words of my mouth.

column1: 2 ^ Apèriem in parábolîs os meum~; loqŭer propositiónes ab inìtio. ^ I will open my mouth in parables~; I will utter propositions from the beginning.
3 ^ Quanta aŭdívimus
column2: et cognóvimus ea
column3: et patres nostri narravérunt nobîs. ^ How great things have we heard
column4: and we have known them
column5: and our fathers have told us.

column1: 4 ^ Non sunt occultáta a fíliîs eórum in generatióne áltera. Narrántes laŭdes Dòmini
column2: et virtútes ejus
column3: et mirabìlia ejus qŭaĕ fecit. ^ They have not been hidden from their children in another generation. Declaring the praises of the Lord
column4: and his powers
column5: and his wonders which he hath done.

column1: 5 ^ Et suscitávit testimónium in Jacóbe
column2: et legem pósuit in Israhéle
column3: qŭanta mandávit pátribus nostrîs nota fácere ea fíliîs suîs
column4: ^ And he set up a testimony in Jacob
column5: and made a law in Israel
column6: how great things he commanded our fathers that they should make them  known to their children

column1: 6 ^ ut cognóscat generátio áltera
column2: fílii qŭi nascèntur
column3: et exsùrgent et narrábunt fíliîs suîs
column4: ^ that another generation might know them
column5: sons that should be born
column6: and should rise up and declare them to their children.

column1: 7 ^ ut pónant in Deo spem suam
column2: et non obliviscántur óperum Dei
column3: et mandáta ejus exqŭírant
column4: ^ that they may put their hope in God
column5: and may not forget the works of God

column1: 8 ^ ne fiant sicut patres eórum
column2: generátio práva et exásperans
column3: generátio qŭaĕ non diréxit cor suum
column4: et non est créditus cum Deo spíritûs ejus. ^ that they may not become like their fathers
column5: a perverse and exasperating generation
column6: a generation that set not their heart aright
column7: and whose spirit was not faithful with God.

column1: 9 ^ Fílii Èfraímis intendèntes et mittèntes arcum~; convèrsi sunt in die belli. ^ The sons of Ephraim who bend and shoot with the bow~; they have turned back in the day of battle.
10 ^ Non custodivérunt testamèntum Dei
column2: et in lege ejus noluérunt ambuláre. ^ They kept not the covenant of God
column3: and in his law they would not walk.

column1: 11 ^ Et oblíti sunt benefactórum ejus
column2: et mirabílium ejus qŭaĕ ostènsit eîs
column3: ^ And they forgot his benefits
column4: and his wonders that he had shown them

column1: 12 ^ coram pátribus eórum fecit mirabìlia in terra Aegìpti
column2: in campo Tanis. ^ wonderful things did he do in the sight of their fathers in the land of Egypt
column3: in the field of Tanis.

column1: 13 ^ Interrúpit mare
column2: et perdúxit eos~; statúvit aqŭas qŭasi in utre
column3: ^ He divided the sea
column4: and brought them through~; he made the waters to stand as in a vessel.

column1: 14 ^ et dedúxit eos in nube diéi
column2: et tota nòcte in illúminatióne ìgnis. ^ and he conducted them with a cloud by day
column3: and all the night with a light of fire.

column1: 15 ^ Interrúpit pètram in erémo
column2: et adaqŭávit eos vèlut in abìsso mùlto. ^ He struck the rock in the wilderness
column3: and gave them to drink as out of the great deep.

column1: 16 ^ Et edúxit aqŭam de pètra
column2: et dedúxit tamqŭam flúmina aqŭas. ^ And he brought forth water out of the rock
column3: and made streams run down as rivers.

column1: 17 ^ Et apposuérunt adhûc peccáre ei~; in iram excitavérunt Excèlsum in inaqŭóso. ^ And they added yet more sin against him~; they provoked the most High to wrath in the place without water.
18 ^ Et tentavérunt Deum in córdibus suîs
column2: ut pèterent escas animábus suîs. ^ And they tempted God in their hearts
column3: by asking meat for their desires.

column1: 19 ^ Et male locúti sunt de Deo
column2: et dixérunt
column3: «~¿~Numqŭid póterit Deus paráre mensam in desèrto~?~». ^ And they spoke ill of God
column4: and they said
column5: "Can God furnish a table in the wilderness~?"

column1: 20 ^ Qŭóniam percùssit pètram
column2: et fluxérunt aqŭaĕ
column3: et torrèntes inundavèrunt. ¿~Numqŭid et panem póterit dare
column4: aŭt paráre mensam pòpulo suo~? ^ Because he struck the rock
column5: and the waters gushed out
column6: and the streams overflowed. Can he also give bread
column7: or provide a table for his people~?

column1: 21 ^ Ìdeo aŭdívit Dòminus
column2: et dìstulit
column3: et ìgnis accènsus est in Jacóbe
column4: et ira ascènsit in Israhéle. ^ Therefore the Lord heard
column5: and was angry
column6: and a fire was kindled against Jacob
column7: and wrath came up against Israel.

column1: 22 ^ Qŭia non credidérunt in Deo
column2: nec speravérunt in salutári ejus. ^ Because they believed not in God
column3: and trusted not in his salvation.

column1: 23 ^ Et mandávit núbibus désuper
column2: et jánuas caĕli apèruit. ^ And he had commanded the clouds from above
column3: and had opened the doors of heaven.

column1: 24 ^ Et plúvit illîs mannam ad manducándum
column2: et panem caĕli dèdit eîs. ^ And had rained down manna upon them to eat
column3: and had given them the bread of heaven.

column1: 25 ^ Panem angelórum manducávit hòmo~; cibária misit eîs in abundántia. ^ Man ate the bread of angels~; he sent them provisions in abundance.
26 ^ Tránstulit aŭstrum de caĕlo
column2: et indúxit in virtúte sua Áfricum. ^ He removed the south wind from heaven
column3: and by his power brought in the southwest wind.

column1: 27 ^ Et pluvit super eos sicut pùlverem carnes
column2: et sicut arénam maris vulatìlia pennáta. ^ And he rained upon them flesh as dust
column3: and feathered fowls like as the sand of the sea.

column1: 28 ^ Et cecidérunt in mèdio castrórum eórum
column2: cìrca tabernácula eórum. ^ And they fell in the midst of their camp
column3: round about their pavilions.

column1: 29 ^ Et manducavérunt
column2: et saturáti sunt nìmis
column3: et desidèrium eórum áttulit eîs~; ^ So they did eat
column4: and were filled exceedingly
column5: and he gave them their desire~;

column1: 30 ^ non sunt fraŭdáti a desidèrio suo. Adhûc escaĕ eórum èrant in ore ipsórum
column2: ^ they were not defraŭded of that which they craved. As yet their meat was in their mouth

column1: 31 ^ et ira Dei ascènsit super eos
column2: et occáĕsit pingŭes eórum
column3: et eléctos Israhélis impedívit. ^ and the wrath of God came upon them
column4: and he slew the fat ones amongst them
column5: and brought down the chosen men of Israel.

column1: 32 ^ In òmnibus hîs peccavérunt adhûc
column2: et non credidérunt in mirabìlibus ejus. ^ In all these things they sinned still
column3: and they behaved not for his wondrous works.

column1: 33 ^ Et defecérunt in vanitáte dies eórum
column2: et anni eórum cum festinatióne. ^ And their days were consumed in vanity
column3: and their years with haste.

column1: 34 ^ Qŭum occáĕderet eos
column2: qŭaĕrébant eum
column3: et revertebántur
column4: et dilúculo věniébant ad eum. ^ When he slew them
column5: then they sought him
column7: and came to him early in the morning.

column1: 35 ^ Et rememoráti sunt qŭia Deus adjútor est eórum
column2: et Deus excèlsus redèmptor eórum est. ^ And they remembered that God was their helper
column3: and the most high God their redeemer.

column1: 36 ^ Et dilexérunt eum in ore suo
column2: et lingŭa sua mentíti sunt ei. ^ And they loved him with their mouth
column3: and with their tongue they lied unto him.

column1: 37 ^ Cor aŭtem eórum non èrat rectum cum eo
column2: nec fidéles hábiti sunt in testamènto ejus. ^ But their heart was not right with him
column3: nor were they counted faithful in his covenant.

column1: 38 ^ Ìpse aŭtem est misèricors
column2: et propìtius fíet peccátîs eórum
column3: et non dispèrdet eos
column4: et abundávit ut avèrteret iram suam
column5: et non accèndit òmnem iram suam. ^ But he is merciful
column8: and many a time did he turn away his anger
column9: and did not kindle all his wrath.

column1: 39 ^ Et recordátus est qŭia carnis sunt
column2: spíritus vadens et non rèdiens. ^ And he remembered that they are flesh
column3: a wind that goeth and returneth not.

column1: 40 ^ Quóties exacerbavérunt eum in desèrto~; in iram concitavérunt eum in inaqŭóso. ^ How often did they provoke him in the desert~; they moved him to wrath in the place without water.
41 ^ Et convèrsi sunt
column2: et tentavérunt Deum
column3: et sanctum Israhélis exacerbavérunt. ^ And they turned back
column4: and tempted God
column5: and grieved the holy one of Israel.

column1: 42 ^ Non sunt recordáti manûs ejus
column2: die qŭa redémit eos de manu tribulántis~; ^ They remembered not his hand
column3: in the day that he redeemed them from the hand of him that afflicted them~;

column1: 43 ^ sicut pósuit in Aegìpto sìgna sua
column2: et prodìgia sua in campo Tanis. ^ how he wrought his signs in Egypt
column3: and his wonders in the field of Tanis.

column1: 44 ^ Et convèrsit in sángŭinem flúmina eórum
column2: et imbres eórum
column3: ne bìberent. ^ And he turned their rivers into blood
column4: and their showers that they might not drink.

column1: 45 ^ misit in eos cinómiam
column2: et comédit eos
column3: et ranam
column4: et dispèrdidit eos. ^ He sent amongst them divers sorts of flies
column5: and it devoured them

column1: 46 ^ Et dèdit aĕrúgini fructûs eórum
column2: et labóres eórum locùstaĕ. ^ And he gave up their fruits to the blast
column3: and their labours to the locust.

column1: 47 ^ Et occáĕsit in grándine víneas eórum
column2: et moros eórum in pruína. ^ And he destroyed their vineyards with hail
column3: and their mulberry trees with hoarfrost.

column1: 48 ^ Et trádidit grándini jumènta eórum
column2: et possessiónem eórum ìgni. ^ And he gave up their cattle to the hail
column3: and their stock to the fire.

column1: 49 ^ misit in eos iram indignatiónis suaĕ
column2: indignatiónem et iram et tribulatiónem
column3: immissiónes per ángelos malos. ^ And he sent upon them the wrath of his indignation
column4: indignation and wrath and trouble
column5: a sending forth by evil angels.

column1: 50 ^ Viam fecit sémitaĕ iraĕ suaĕ~; non pepèrcit a morte animábus eórum
column2: et jumènta eórum in morte conclúsit. ^ He made a way for a path to his anger~; he spared not their souls from death
column3: and their cattle he shut up in death.

column1: 51 ^ Et percùssit omne primogènitum in terra Aegìpti~; primìtias òmnis labóris eórum in tabernáculîs Chami. ^ And he killed all the firstborn in the land of Egypt~; the firstfruits of all their labour in the tabernacles of Cham.
52 ^ Et ábstulit sicut oves pòpulum suum
column2: et perdúxit eos tamqŭam grègem in desèrto. ^ And he took away his own people as sheep
column3: and guided them in the wilderness like a flock.

column1: 53 ^ Et dedúxit eos in spe
column2: et non timuérunt
column3: et inimícos eórum opèruit mare. ^ And he brought them out in hope
column4: and they feared not
column5: and the sea overwhelmed their enemies.

column1: 54 ^ Et indúxit eos in mòntem sanctificatiónis suaĕ
column2: mòntem qŭem acqŭisívit dèxtera ejus. ^ And he brought them into the mountain of his sanctuary
column3: the mountain which his right hand had purchased.

column1: 55 ^ Et ejécit a fácie eórum gèntes
column2: et sorte divísit eîs terram in funículo distributiónis
column3: et habitáre fecit in tabernáculîs eórum trìbûs Israhélis. ^ And he cast out the Gentiles before them
column4: and by lot divided to them their land by a line of distribution
column5: and he made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tabernacles.

column1: 56 ^ Et tentavérunt
column2: et exacerbavérunt Deum excèlsum
column3: et testimónia ejus non custodivérunt. ^ Yet they tempted
column4: and provoked the most high God
column5: and they kept not his testimonies.

column1: 57 ^ Et avertérunt se
column2: et non servavérunt pactum
column3: qŭemádmodum patres eórum~; convèrsi sunt in arcum pravum. ^ And they turned away
column4: and kept not the covenant
column5: even like their fathers~; they were turned aside as a crooked bow.

column1: 58 ^ In iram concitavérunt eum in còllibus suîs
column2: et in sculptìlibus suîs ad aĕmulatiónem eum provocavérunt. ^ They provoked him to anger on their hills
column3: and moved him to jealousy with their graven things.

column1: 59 ^ Aŭdívit Deus
column2: et sprevit
column3: et ad nìhilum redégit valde Israhélem. ^ God heard
column4: and despised them
column5: and he reduced Israel exceedingly as it were to nothing.

column1: 60 ^ Et rèpulit tabernáculum Silónis
column2: tabernáculum suum
column3: ubi habitávit in homìnibus. ^ And he put away the tabernacle of Silo
column4: his tabernacle
column5: where he dwelt among men.

column1: 61 ^ Et trádidit in captivitátem virtútem eórum
column2: et pulcritúdinem eórum in manûs inimíci. ^ And he delivered their strength into captivity
column3: and their beauty into the hands of the enemy.

column1: 62 ^ Et conclúsit in gládio pòpulum suum
column2: et hereditátem suam sprevit. ^ And he shut up his people under the sword
column3: and he despised his inheritance.

column1: 63 ^ Júvenes eórum comédit ignîs
column2: et vìrgines eórum non sunt lamentátaĕ. ^ Fire consumed their young men
column3: and their maidens were not lamented.

column1: 64 ^ Sacerdótes eórum in gládio cecidérunt
column2: et vìduaĕ eórum non plorabántur. ^ Their priests fell by the sword
column3: and their widows did not mourn.

column1: 65 ^ Et excitátus est tamqŭam dormiens Dòminus
column2: tamqŭam potens crapulátus a vino. ^ And the Lord was awaked as one out of sleep
column3: so as a mighty man that hath been surfeited with wine.

column1: 66 ^ Et percùssit inimícos suos in posterióra~; oppróbrium sempitèrnum dédit illîs. ^ And he smote his enemies on the hinder parts~; he put them to an everlasting reproach.
67 ^ Et rèpulit tabernáculum Joséfi
column2: et trìbum Efraímis non elégit
column3: ^ And he rejected the tabernacle of Joseph
column4: and chose not the tribe of Ephraim

column1: 68 ^ sed elégit trìbum Judaĕ
column2: mòntem Siónis qŭem diléxit. ^ but he chose the tribe of Judah
column3: mount Sion which he loved.

column1: 69 ^ Et aĕdificávit sicut unicórnium sanctifìcium suum
column2: in terra qŭam fundávit in sáĕcula. ^ And he built his sanctuary as of unicorns
column3: in the land which he founded for ever.

column1: 70 ^ Et elégit Davídem servum suum
column2: et sùstulit eum de grègibus óvium~; ^ And he chose his servant David
column3: and took him from the flocks of sheep~;

column1: 71 ^ De post fetántes accépit eum
column2: páscere Jacóbem servum suum
column3: et Israhélem hereditátem suam. ^ he brought him from following the ewes great with young
column4: to feed Jacob his servant
column5: and Israel his inheritance.

column1: 72 ^ Et pávit eos in innocèntia cordis sui
column2: et in intelléctibus mánuum suárum dedúxit eos. ^ And he fed them in the innocence of his heart
column3: and conducted them by the skilfulness of his hands.
